Name: Develop & Maintain Grid
Documentation: The end-to-end process of planning, building, and maintaining the physical grid infrastructure.

Name: Plan & Design
Documentation: The strategic process of planning for future grid needs and designing the required assets.

Name: Plan Network Expansion
Documentation: Analyzes future load and generation patterns to create long-term network expansion plans.

Name: Design & Engineer Bulk Assets
Documentation: Creates detailed engineering specifications and designs for major grid components like substations and transmission lines.

Name: Build Assets
Documentation: The operational process of constructing new assets and commissioning them into service.

Name: Construct & Commission Bulk Assets
Documentation: Manages the construction, testing, and commissioning of new high-voltage grid infrastructure.

Name: Maintain Assets
Documentation: The operational process of performing ongoing maintenance on existing infrastructure to ensure reliability.

Name: Inspect & Maintain Assets
Documentation: Performs routine inspections, preventative maintenance, and corrective repairs on grid assets.

Name: Deliver Energy
Documentation: The core process of operating the grid in real-time to ensure the reliable and secure flow of electricity from generators to consumers.

Name: Operate & Monitor
Documentation: The continuous process of forecasting energy needs, balancing the system, and monitoring grid status.

Name: Forecast Load & Generation
Documentation: Predicts short-term electricity demand and generation availability to inform operational planning.

Name: Balance Supply & Demand
Documentation: Manages generation dispatch and ancillary services to match electricity supply with demand in real-time.

Name: Monitor & Control Grid
Documentation: Provides real-time visibility into grid conditions and executes control actions to maintain stability.

Name: Respond & Restore
Documentation: The process of detecting, responding to, and restoring service after a grid outage or fault.

Name: Restore Service
Documentation: Identifies fault locations, dispatches crews, and executes switching plans to restore power to affected customers.

Name: Connect New Service
Documentation: The end-to-end process for safely and efficiently connecting new generation sources or large loads to the grid.

Name: Process & Study
Documentation: The initial phase of handling a new connection request, including administrative processing and technical impact analysis.

Name: Process Interconnection Request
Documentation: Receives and validates applications from customers seeking to connect to the grid.

Name: Conduct Impact Study
Documentation: Performs engineering analysis to determine the impact of the proposed connection on grid stability and reliability.

Name: Implement & Energize
Documentation: The phase of designing, constructing, and energizing the physical assets required for a new connection.

Name: Design & Approve Connection
Documentation: Develops the specific engineering designs and plans for the physical interconnection.

Name: Construct & Energize Connection
Documentation: Manages the construction and final commissioning of the new service connection.

Name: Grid Asset Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the entire lifecycle of physical grid assets, from planning and acquisition to maintenance and disposal.

Name: Strategic Asset Planning
Documentation: The ability to develop long-term strategies for asset investment, replacement, and risk management.

Name: Asset Health & Risk Assessment
Documentation: The ability to assess the condition and failure risk of grid assets using data and analytics.

Name: Investment & Capital Planning
Documentation: The ability to prioritize and plan capital projects for grid enhancement and replacement.

Name: Network Development
Documentation: The ability to design, engineer, and manage the development of new grid infrastructure.

Name: Network Topology Planning
Documentation: The ability to model and analyze the grid's physical and electrical layout to plan for changes.

Name: Bulk Infrastructure Design & Engineering
Documentation: The ability to create detailed technical designs for high-voltage transmission and substation assets.

Name: Asset Construction
Documentation: The ability to manage and execute the construction of new grid infrastructure.

Name: Bulk Construction Project Management
Documentation: The ability to manage large-scale construction projects for new grid infrastructure.

Name: Asset Operations & Maintenance
Documentation: The ability to perform day-to-day operations and maintenance activities to ensure asset reliability.

Name: Predictive & Condition-Based Maintenance
Documentation: The ability to use real-time data to predict asset failures and optimize maintenance schedules.

Name: Routine Inspection & Testing
Documentation: The ability to perform scheduled inspections and tests on grid equipment to ensure operational readiness.

Name: Vegetation Management
Documentation: The ability to manage vegetation growth near power lines to prevent outages.

Name: Real-Time Grid Control
Documentation: The ability to monitor, control, and optimize the bulk power system in real-time to ensure stability and reliability.

Name: Load & Generation Forecasting
Documentation: The ability to predict near-term electricity demand and generation output.

Name: Demand Forecasting
Documentation: The ability to create accurate forecasts of electricity consumption across various time horizons.

Name: Generation Forecasting
Documentation: The ability to predict the output of variable generation sources like wind and solar.

Name: System Monitoring & Control
Documentation: The ability to visualize grid status and execute remote control actions on grid equipment.

Name: SCADA System Operation
Documentation: The ability to operate Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition systems to monitor and control the grid.

Name: EMS/DMS Operation
Documentation: The ability to operate Energy/Distribution Management Systems for advanced grid analysis and optimization.

Name: Outage Detection & Localization
Documentation: The ability to automatically detect power outages and pinpoint their location on the grid.

Name: System Balancing & Optimization
Documentation: The ability to balance electricity supply and demand continuously and optimize power flows.

Name: Frequency & Voltage Regulation
Documentation: The ability to maintain system frequency and voltage levels within safe operational limits.

Name: Ancillary Service Dispatch
Documentation: The ability to dispatch services like spinning reserves to support grid stability.

Name: Congestion Management
Documentation: The ability to manage power flows to prevent overloading of transmission lines.

Name: Incident & Restoration Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the response to grid incidents and coordinate service restoration efforts.

Name: Fault Isolation & Service Restoration
Documentation: The ability to isolate faulted sections of the grid and restore power to customers through switching operations.

Name: Field Crew Dispatch & Coordination
Documentation: The ability to dispatch and manage field crews for repair and restoration activities.

Name: Customer Outage Communication
Documentation: The ability to provide timely and accurate information to customers during power outages.

Name: Grid Service Provisioning
Documentation: The ability to manage the processes for providing grid access and services to customers and third parties.

Name: Customer Connection Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the application and study phase of new grid interconnection requests.

Name: Interconnection Request Processing
Documentation: The ability to manage the intake, validation, and tracking of new service connection applications.

Name: Connection Implementation
Documentation: The ability to manage the design, construction, and energization of new grid connections.

Name: Connection Design & Engineering
Documentation: The ability to create specific engineering designs for customer-requested grid interconnections.

Name: Connection Construction & Energization
Documentation: The ability to oversee the physical construction and final commissioning of a new service connection.

Name: Metering & Billing
Documentation: The ability to measure customer energy consumption and manage the billing and invoicing process.

Name: Metering & Data Collection
Documentation: The ability to install, maintain, and collect data from electricity meters.

Name: Usage Data Processing
Documentation: The ability to validate, estimate, and aggregate meter data for billing purposes.

Name: Billing & Invoicing
Documentation: The ability to generate and manage customer invoices based on processed usage data.

Name: Energy Market Operations
Documentation: The ability to participate in wholesale energy markets, including bidding, scheduling, and settlement.

Name: Transmission Rights Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the acquisition and scheduling of rights to use the transmission system.

Name: Auction & Reservation
Documentation: The ability to participate in auctions and reserve transmission capacity.

Name: Scheduling
Documentation: The ability to create and submit schedules for energy transmission.

Name: Market Settlement & Reconciliation
Documentation: The ability to manage the financial settlement and reconciliation of energy market transactions.

Name: Charge Calculation
Documentation: The ability to calculate charges and credits based on market activity.

Name: Dispute Resolution
Documentation: The ability to manage and resolve discrepancies in market settlement statements.

Name: Grid Asset
Documentation: Information representing the physical components of the electricity grid.

Name: Transmission & Distribution Infrastructure
Documentation: Information about the physical network components, such as lines, substations, and transformers.

Name: Power Line
Documentation: Data defining the characteristics and state of a specific power line.

Name: Substation
Documentation: Data defining the characteristics and state of a specific substation.

Name: Transformer
Documentation: Data defining the characteristics and state of a specific transformer.

Name: Asset Health Record
Documentation: Information about the condition, performance, and risk associated with grid assets.

Name: Condition Data
Documentation: Raw and processed data from inspections, sensors, and tests regarding asset health.

Name: Risk Analysis
Documentation: The calculated risk profile and health index for a specific asset or asset class.

Name: Maintenance Work Order
Documentation: Information required to plan, execute, and track maintenance work on grid assets.

Name: Work Order Details
Documentation: The scope, required materials, and procedures for a specific maintenance task.

Name: Work Order Status
Documentation: The current status, resource assignment, and completion records for a work order.

Name: Grid State
Documentation: Information representing the operational state of the electricity grid at any given time.

Name: Real-Time Grid Data
Documentation: Streaming telemetry data from the grid, including measurements from various sensors.

Name: SCADA Measurement
Documentation: Real-time data points (e.g., voltage, current, power flow) from SCADA systems.

Name: Phasor Measurement Unit Data
Documentation: High-resolution, time-synchronized data on voltage and current phasors.

Name: Grid Topology Model
Documentation: A digital representation of the grid's components and their electrical connectivity.

Name: Network Model
Documentation: The detailed electrical parameter model of the grid used for power flow analysis.

Name: Connectivity Model
Documentation: The representation of how grid components are physically and electrically connected.

Name: Outage Record
Documentation: Information documenting a power outage event, its cause, and the restoration process.

Name: Outage Log
Documentation: A time-stamped record of an outage event, including affected areas and customer reports.

Name: Restoration Plan
Documentation: The sequence of switching actions and crew assignments required to restore service.

Name: Grid Service Agreement
Documentation: Information representing the contractual agreements for providing or receiving services from the grid.

Name: Interconnection Agreement
Documentation: The legal and technical agreement for connecting a customer's facility to the grid.

Name: Terms & Conditions
Documentation: The contractual terms, obligations, and service levels of an interconnection agreement.

Name: Technical Specifications
Documentation: The detailed engineering specifications and requirements for the physical interconnection.

Name: Transmission Service Request
Documentation: A formal request to reserve and schedule the use of the transmission network.

Name: Request Details
Documentation: The specific parameters of a transmission service request, such as path, capacity, and timing.

Name: Service Schedule
Documentation: The confirmed schedule and profile for an approved transmission service.

Name: Customer Metering Data
Documentation: Information about a customer's energy consumption collected from meters.

Name: Interval Data
Documentation: Granular time-series data of energy consumption, typically in 15- or 60-minute intervals.

Name: Profile Data
Documentation: Aggregated or processed consumption data used to create customer load profiles.
